DataElement.preferredName: Umbilical Cord Blood Storage Method Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the storage method type that was used for the umbilical cord blood.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Blood from the umbilical cord of a newborn baby. This blood contains high concentrations of stem cells (cells from which all blood cells develop)._The act of safekeeping goods in a depository._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal. [Manually curated]

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of autologous lymphocytes for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for leukemia or lymphoma.:The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

Concepts.definition: Blood present in the umbilical vessels at the time of delivery. If cryopreserved at birth, cord blood can serve as a source of hematopoietic progenitor cells for transplantation to a patient later diagnosed and treated for a hematopoietic disorder.
The act of safekeeping goods in a depository.

Property.preferredDefinition: A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The act of safekeeping goods in a depository._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal._Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to about -200 degrees Celsius.

Concepts.definition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to -196 degrees Celsius.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A cryogenic process for the storage and/or shipping of  biospecimens. The item to be frozen is placed above a shallow reservoir of cooling liquid in a storage vessel. A vertical temperature gradient is maintained throughout the vapor layer to ensure temperatures sufficiently low to maintain the integrity of the stored material.

Concepts.definition: A cryogenic process for the storage and/or shipping of biospecimens. The item to be frozen is placed above a shallow reservoir of cooling liquid in a storage vessel. A vertical temperature gradient is maintained throughout the vapor layer to ensure temperatures sufficiently low to maintain the integrity of the stored material.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A refrigerated cabinet or room for preserving materials at or below 32F (0C).

Concepts.definition: A refrigerated cabinet or room for preserving materials at or below 32F (0C).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities
